headline: DeWine tests positive for COVID-19
sentences:
VW independent staff
COLUMBUS – Governor Mike DeWine announced on Friday that he has been diagnosed with COVID-19 by his personal physician.
According to his office, DeWine has been experiencing mild symptoms such as a runny nose, head ache, body aches, and a sore throat.
Copyright © 2010-2022 The Van Wert Independent — Subscribe to our RSS feed — Web Site Design by J. DeWert Enterprises, LLC
DeWine and Mrs. DeWine are fully vaccinated, each having received the two-dose vaccination and a booster shot.
Earlier on Friday,DeWine received a monoclonal antibody treatment and is in quarantine.
First Lady Fran DeWine is experiencing no symptoms and has tested negative.
